CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 24, 1963, pg. 2 reads: "Honor Campers - Scoutmaster Robert Brookins (second from right) and three of his Scouts, William Taylor (right), a Star Scout; Charles Johnson (left) and Craig Jones (center), are shown receiving congratulations from Fred Gladney (second from left), for their induction into the Order of the Arrow, which took place at Camp Semiconon recently. This order is a national organization of honor campers, which is one of the highest honors in scouting.  These Scouts represent Troop 49 of Mt. Ararat Baptist Church, of which Mr. Gladney is the advancement chairman of the troop committee."
TitMainTitle: Scoutmaster Robert Brookins, shaking hands with Fred Gladney, while Pack 49 troop members Charles Johnson, left; Craig Jones, center; and William Taylor, right; look on, posed in interior during induction of scouts into the Order of the Arrow
